poem:
Title: A Tale of Two Worlds

"Sunak and Murty, their riches soar,
While working Britons bear the chore.
A tale not of envy, but of rift,
As fortunes rise, and hardships drift.
Dissimilar are the tides of fate,
One swims in gold, others wait.
Is this the fruit, perchance, of power?
A bountiful bloom in the ivory tower.
Yet in our hearts, a common wealth,
Unmeasured by their hoarded stealth."
